website_summaries.verdict: This crane literally and figuratively towers over everything in the Technic collection due to its incredibly intricate design and impressive electric controls.
pros: Control the fully-functional crane to lower its legs, rotate it 360 degrees, lift its winch, and more
Engine sports moving pistons and fan
cons: Expensive, even for a LEGO Technic set

customer_reviews.title: it's lego.
customer_reviews.text: it's lego! it has power functions that allow it to rotate 360 degrees, left or right. it can raise or lower the boom 3 feet high. the things (don't know technical term) that go up/down to balance/keep weight off tires are electric...i can go on and on. there is so much inside --i can't carry it one handed. i had a yellow crane which i thought was cool. this one blows it away. highly recommended!!! it is a 4x4 (not powered) with differentials.
customer_reviews.author: J. garcia

customer_reviews.title: Patience !!!
customer_reviews.text: This was a project for my ten year old son. He built the NASA rocket all by himself when he was Nine. This was I thought suitable more for 13 year old. I would purchase again just be ware it takes much patience and several hours over three weeks time .
customer_reviews.author: Annie Oak

customer_reviews.title: great kit
customer_reviews.text: Lot of parts took a while to build but is lot of fun and looks really cool
customer_reviews.author: Voodoo Jester

customer_reviews.title: It's like the real thing!
customer_reviews.text: This you crane is amazing! It has gears and other parts that do things that a real crane would do. My grandson really enjoyed building it and still plays with it. We were very impressed.
customer_reviews.author: grammyL

customer_reviews.title: Beatup box, perfect product
customer_reviews.text: This was a new sealed product, and the lego toy itself is wonderful. If you are expecting a box in perfect condition, just order it straight from lego. Mine came all the way from Germany in a beatup box that looked hastely taped together with odds and ends of cardboard. If you don't care about the box, go ahead and order it and save a couple bucks.
customer_reviews.author: Jon VW

customer_reviews.title: You wont be disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Its lego... fun, moderately complex and rewarding after the build is done. Being an AFOL I had a great time building it, trying to crane all sorts of things. Good buy, great fun, worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Great gifts
customer_reviews.text: Received quickly. Bought 2 as gifts. Came boxed nicely, no damage. Can't wait to help put it together. 🙂
customer_reviews.author: J Capps

customer_reviews.title: Item quality
customer_reviews.text: Today I received the replacement item. And then I open up. The box look like that. Don’t waste time to order that. They don’t give your brand new one!
customer_reviews.author: Kenji liu

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my fiancé. He loved it. Had it put together in a few days and it kept him out of my hair ;)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice gift.
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift but greatly appreciated by the recipient.
customer_reviews.author: Lew

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun.
customer_reviews.text: My son and I had a blast putting this together.
customer_reviews.author: steven cafiero

customer_reviews.title: well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: very impressed with it well engineered good instructions this was the 10th lego kit I have put together
customer_reviews.author: edward c hegg

customer_reviews.title: Buy it now while it's still cheap.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great set. I had a really good time building it.

customer_reviews.title: All around awesome!!
customer_reviews.text: A really fun build. Enjoyed the fact that it gave me a Good challenge!
customer_reviews.author: Phat-Pat

customer_reviews.title: Bad service delivery from AAA Games
customer_reviews.text: The box came as it is. Torn , taped, shabby. Needed it as gift... very disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: E. C

customer_reviews.title: Big crane
customer_reviews.text: This crane took me a little over a week to build had some missing pieces. 1 of the functions does not work the crane will spin around by hand but it will not go in it's own not sure if the crane gears are not the best also the crane boom as it god out has a hard time extending with the first 2 gears sounds like it is sticking some where tryed to figure it out will trying again to figure it out.
customer_reviews.author: donald moore

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT buy this one on Amazon
customer_reviews.text: I'm very sure this is an awesome LEGO set. The set itself deserves 5 stars but I couldn't find any place to leave feedback for Amazon's service. I strongly suggest NOT TO BUY IT FROM AMAZON especially if you are sensitive or value the item's box condition as all collectors do. Amazon put the delivery label on the item box. They chose to be so cheap NOT to put the item in a packaging box. I'm very disappointed with Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: YONGBOK GO

customer_reviews.title: This crane is huge!
customer_reviews.text: This crane took quite a while to put together, but it is totally worth the money. It is amazing what LEGO has come up with. The gearbox and operating system on this set works great and is fun to build.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Van Houtte

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Great set to do during quarantine. Took me 3 days about 6-7 hours a day to assemble. It's huge and I used it to pickup a couple of heavy MOC trucks that I have sitting the shelf. The thing that amazes me the most is theres only 1 motor that does so many different functions all based on different switch configurations.
customer_reviews.author: Micky Mouse

customer_reviews.title: Awesome even for an adult!
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my husband. He loved putting it together. He bought separate plans and made a Rube Goldberg contraption out of it and now wants to rebuild the crane.
customer_reviews.author: K. Hansen

customer_reviews.title: Very Rugged
customer_reviews.text: Directions were clear. Kid has played with it over and over and is still holding strong. Everything stays locked in place. Can pick up quite heavy objects.
customer_reviews.author: Rochelle Giczkowski

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts-again
customer_reviews.text: Once again. Missing parts. Once again LEGO refuses to replace them but says I can purchase them. Pretty expensive kits to have to buy parts that should have been included. Very common problem to the multiple kits I’ve purchased for my husband.
customer_reviews.author: bonnie smith

customer_reviews.title: looks good on my construction site
customer_reviews.text: This was the largest technic Lego model I ever built. It was a challenge, but, after all said and done, it functions well. You, should add an upgrade to this kit, to make it fully remote control
customer_reviews.author: William Parrish

customer_reviews.title: Great set to challenge your skills
customer_reviews.text: Great addition to my collection of LEGO cranes I have them all
customer_reviews.author: smitty

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Very complex and engaging LEGO set with an amazing outcome!
customer_reviews.author: santiago

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I wasn’t really sure if I’d like it for the price, “ also since I haven’t touched legos in 25 years” but all in all it was a fun build. Makes a great display piece in the end. Took a couple days to assemble. Most instructions are pretty straight forward.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Shipped in original packing. Box was destroyed when delivered.
customer_reviews.text: No problem with the LEGO set. Problem with seller shipping item in original box. Amazon returned it with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: sherry

customer_reviews.title: Awesome kit
customer_reviews.text: Excellent build, it has power functions, no remote control. Be careful to orient gears properly
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect gift for lego enthsiasts!
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my son! Gave him many hours of joy!
customer_reviews.author: tjo

customer_reviews.title: lego 42080 and 42082
customer_reviews.text: Easy to follow instructions for assembly, given as birthday present to grandchild
customer_reviews.author: Cathy

customer_reviews.title: This product is great
customer_reviews.text: I like led the complexity of it. It kept my mind working
customer_reviews.author: Pat potempa

customer_reviews.title: All I can say is WOW
customer_reviews.text: I just finished the build. This is only my second Technic build and I was very impressed with the attention to detail. I can only imagine what goes into designing a kit like this. I like how many funtctions the crane performs, very cool that it does them all with just one motor. If I had one bit of advice it would be take your time and double check every illustration with what you just built. It’s easy to make a mistake that can take a while to correct. I highly recommend this kit and can’t wait for the next one.
customer_reviews.author: scott

customer_reviews.title: If you are no used to put things together, you should start with a smaller and simpler set
customer_reviews.text: My package came with some broken bags and parts missing, that’s was kind of bad BUT I asked for a exchange and the next day a got a new one Excellent how quickly I got a new one no question ask Thanks a lot The product, is not a toy, it’s a master piece The quality is unbelievable I’m almost half way done and I get more impress every new step As soon as I finish this set I’m getting an other one
customer_reviews.author: GERARDO DANIEL GRASSO

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: Unlike other two Technic sets I have (4205 - Excavator and 42043 - Mercedes truck) which did not work smoothly, all 5 motorized functions of 42082 work perfectly. In the end, this really becomes a functional toy, that does not get you or kids frustated. After getting a little frustated with 42055 and 42043, this would be my last try with big Technic sets, but is easly 10/10.
customer_reviews.author: jgslima

customer_reviews.title: A lot of fun and entertaining.
customer_reviews.text: I had a great time putting this together. I am recuperating from a knee surgery and I needed something to pass the time. I am 50 years old and have not played with Legos in 40 years. The instructions were easy to follow and I put it together over a 7 day period. I plan on building another LEGO project.
customer_reviews.author: MJJC

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Okay. Ive bought many lego sets in my time, and bought a few Technic sets. This one is one of the bigger Technic sets. I personally loved building it. Over ten hours. It is huge. I would recommend this if you like Lego Technic
customer_reviews.author: max

customer_reviews.title: Great Technic Kit
customer_reviews.text: Lot of parts took a while to build but is lot of fun and looks really cool
customer_reviews.author: Voodoo Jester

customer_reviews.title: Fast shipping, great build!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome, pictures don’t do it justice it’s huge!! It was delivered fast and In great condition, it comes in a box with the LEGO box inside, very sturdy, very big, worth the money and wait! Definitely a great build by LEGO
customer_reviews.author: Isaac

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely bananas
customer_reviews.text: All I gotta say is in terms of parts, it has 100 less than the 42100 but its 150 dollars cheaper. By far the best thing to buy for parts and also a great build
customer_reviews.author: Ryan brush

customer_reviews.title: Enjoy building it
customer_reviews.text: The LEGO was the first ever techic that I bought for my son and it was very big . It was medium to build and the packaging came a well.
customer_reviews.author: Nishtha Viniak

product_meta.title: LEGO Technic Rough Terrain Crane 42082 Building Kit (4056 Pieces)
product_meta.description: Enjoy an immense build and play experience with the LEGO Technic 42082 Rough Terrain Crane, our largest and tallest LEGO Technic rough terrain crane to date, pre-August 2018. Activate the Power Functions and select upper or lower crane mode for complete control over an array of easy‑to‑operate, motorized functions. Lower the stabilizer legs, rotate the superstructure through 360°, operate the lifting winch or send the extendable boom a meter into the air. Manual functions include 4-wheel steering, 4-wheel drive, detailed V8 cylinder engine with moving pistons and fan, and adjustable wing mirrors, plus a detailed operator’s cab with an opening door. This amazing model also includes 2 opening compartments with tools, chains, fire extinguisher, work lights, plus 4 outrigger landing plates and 4 LEGO Technic building sections that can be lifted and assembled. This 2‑in‑1 LEGO Technic set comes with a red and black color scheme and can be rebuilt to create a Mobile Pile Driver.
feature_bullets: Build a heavy-duty rough terrain crane with motorized superstructure, stabilizer legs, 1-meter extendable boom and working winch, plus an array of authentic details and manual functions with this advanced builder set
This 2-in-1 rough terrain crane can be rebuilt into a Mobile Pile Driver, and both construction toys are powered up with LEGO Power Functions

Rough Terrain Crane measures over 39-inch (100cm) high, 25-inch (66cm) long and 10-inch (26cm) wide, Mobile Pile Driver measures over 9-inch (24cm) high, 19-inch (50cm) long and 7-inch (20cm) wide in driving position
4057 pieces – Technical STEM toy for boys and girls aged 11+ and for fans and big kids of all ages
The LEGO Technic Rough Terrain Crane 42082 can be built together with all other original LEGO Technic building sets and LEGO building bricks for creative construction

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars76 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
